pageData.desc: A fundamental course in Web Development utilizing contemporary standards, methods, and tools for students to develop skills in creating and deploying web-based content. Students learn development concepts spanning markup and programming languages and libraries, local and hosted environments, versioning control systems, and development tools.
pageData.obj: The objectives of this course are for students to:
pageData.one: relate web development concepts and terminology,
pageData.two: demonstrate the usage of web development technologies,
pageData.four: determine deﬁciencies in web-based interface design, &
pageData.list: HTML5, Markdown, CSS3, JavaScript/ECMAScript, jQuery, Bootstrap 4
pageData.kstwo: markup, page layouts, behavior, and interaction
pageData.ksthree: Document Object Model manipulation, JavaScript Object Notation
pageData.indentone: File naming, directory/repository conﬁguration, compression, exporting/cloning, hosting conﬁguration/architecture,
pageData.indentthree: Google Style Guide, W3C Accessibility Standards
pageData.trone: DevDocs, W3CSchools, CodeAcademy, Content Delivery Networks, Documentation, Templates
pageData.trtwo: GitHub, Command Line Interface, Wave, Browser Developer Tools, Keyboard Shortcuts, Code Editors
